title: Chicago Collectors
description: This exhibit, which was largely organized by the Men’s Council of the Art Institute, offered viewers a glimpse into the rich private collections of art in Chicago. Pieces included a Greek vase from the 8th century, works by Jean Arp, Alberto Giacometti, and Pablo Picasso. In total, there were 51 paintings, 39 drawings and watercolors, 14 sculptures, 38 primitive objects, 57 oriental works, and 51 pieces of decorative art. Many lenders of the exhibition had rich collections of 19th century art, including Matisse, Léger, Bonnard, Degas, Monet, Pissaro, Braque, Redon, and Courbet. The Men’s Council of the Art Institute worked with the staff of the Art Institute for this exhibition.
